clinical_study.brief_title: Red Light Intervention for Myopia Prevention
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter Randomized Controlled Trial of Low-dose Single-wavelength Red Light in the Decrease of Myopia Incidence Rate in the Setting of School.

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai Eye Disease Prevention and Treatment Center

clinical_study.source: Shanghai Eye Disease Prevention and Treatment Center

brief_summary.textblock: To explore the effectiveness of using low-intensity single-wavelength red light to prevent myopia in schoolchildren, and to provide a feasible scheme for reducing the incidence of myopia.

primary_outcome.measure: One-year cumulative incidence of myopia (%) in the intervention group and the control group.
primary_outcome.description: Myopia is defined as the cycloplegic spherical equivalent of either eye ≤-0.5D

secondary_outcome.measure: The progress of spherical equivalent(SE,D) of children in intervention group and control group.
secondary_outcome.description: The spherical equivalent(SE,D) will be measured by autorefractor(KR-8900, Topcon).

secondary_outcome.measure: The progress of axial length of children in intervention group and control group.
secondary_outcome.description: The axial length will be measured using IOLMaster.

secondary_outcome.measure: The progress of choroidal thickness in children in pre-myopia state in intervention group and control group.
secondary_outcome.description: The choroidal thickness will be measured using SS-OCT.

secondary_outcome.measure: The change of uncorrected visual acuity (UCVA) of children in intervention group and control group.
secondary_outcome.description: The uncorrected visual acuity (UCVA) will be measured using a mounted and illuminated E chart of the Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy study (ETDRS) charts.

arm_group.description: Red light irradiation was conducted at school from Monday to Friday and at home everyday in summer and winter holiday twice a day for 3 minutes per time, with an interval of 4 hours

intervention.description: 2 times a day, 3 minutes each time, with an interval of more than 4 hours. During the semester: From Monday to Friday, set up an intervention room in the school; For winter and summer vacation: everyday at home

overall_official.affiliation: Shanghai Eye Disease Prevention and Treatment Center
